result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Breon Ross Veasley

records.addlTxt: Court ordered DEFENDANT REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff.

Defendant Breon Ross Veasley in court, in custody. Attorney Robert Lee Taylor in court for Breon Ross Veasley.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea hearing with Defendant's other cases 18CF4862, 20CF1624 and 21CM2667. Discussion placed on the record. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State complied with Victim Notification. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record, and confirmed by Defense and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1, COUNT 2, and COUNT 3: 
Defendant changed his plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to the plea, and advised of Constitutional Rights and maximum penalties. Defendant advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found Defendant knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waived all his rights. Parties stipulated to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis for the plea. Court found Defendant GUILTY as charged in the Information, and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, or body armor. 
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored. 

Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing hearing, Reserve Branch. Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2023 at 01:30 pm. Hearing will be held in Room 310 of the Safety Building. 

FILED: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum, and Elements of the Offense/Jury Instructions.

Defendant Breon Ross Veasley not in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Lee Taylor in court for Breon Ross Veasley.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Held off the record. 
Case in Court for Status Conference with Defendant's other case 22CF1624. Defense informed the Court, parties have reached resolution. Case adjourned for Plea hearing. Case remains calendared in Reserve Branch.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Breon Ross Veasley in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Lee Taylor in court for Breon Ross Veasley.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Parties in court for final pre-trial as to Case# 20CF01624.
This case is adjourned for status on the same date as # 20CF01624.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant has two cases before the court.
Case# 20CF01624 scheduled before Branch 25 on October 13, 2022.
This case is rescheduled to the same date.

Clerk:  jms

Case 22CF479 to follow defendant's other case 20CF1624; 20CF1624 scheduled for final pretrial October 14, 2022 at 9:00 am and jury trial October 31, 2022 at 9:00 am in room 310 of the Safety Building; BOTH IN PERSON APPEARANCES. Both parties agreed to date, in person. Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 09:00 am. Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Robert Lee Taylor in court, defendant Breon Ross Veasley not in court, in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel requests an additional Status Conference date, for more time to review with client. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Breon Ross Veasley in court, by zoom, with attorney Aneeq Ahmad for Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Breon Ross Veasley in custody.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Breon Ross Veasley appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for plea hearing.  Attorney Taylor unavailable to appear.  Case scheduled for in-person status conference to allow more time for Attorney Taylor to communicate with defendant; State to file order to produce.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case will be heard in room 503 of the courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No appearance by defense counsel who may be appearing in Branch 45, defendant Breon Ross Veasley not in court, in custody.  amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Case called with 20CF1624.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 16.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

OFF THE RECORD- Attorney Robert Lee Taylor in court, defendant Breon Ross Veasley not in court, in custody.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant not produced. State advises that there may be a possible global resolution. Court sets next court date for a Status Conference. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Breon Ross Veasley in court by video with Attorney Robert Lee Taylor who appears in person.  Defendant Breon Ross Veasley in custody.  John D. Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer. C. Benitez. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. SPD Order Appointing Counsel

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant Breon Ross Veasley in court with attorney Kylie Kaltenberg.  Defendant Breon Ross Veasley in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
